BiblioEntry.Title: Algebraic integrability of the confluent Neumann system
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Algebraic integrability of the confluent Neumann system / Martin Vuk

BiblioSet.Title: Journal of physics. A, Mathematical and theoretical
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Journal of physics. A, Mathematical and theoretical

BiblioEntry.Abstract: V prispevku obravnavamo Neumannov sistem, ki opisuje harmonični oscilator (poljubne dimenzije) omejen na sfero. Posebej obravnavamo konfluentni primer, ko dve lastni vrednosti potenciala sovpadata, kar pomeni, da ima sistem ▫$S^1$▫ simetrijo. Dokažemo algebraično integrabilnost konfluentnega Neumannovega sistema in pokažemo, da je mogoče tok linearizirati na posplošenem Jacobijevem torusu singularne algebraične krivulje. Opišemo tudi simplektično redukcijo delovanja ▫$S^1$▫ in zapišemo splošen Rosochatiusov sistem, kot simplektični kvocient konfluentnega Neumannovega sistema s potencialom, katerega lastne vrednosti nastopajo v parih.

In this paper we study the Neumann system, which describes the harmonic oscillator (of arbitrary dimension) constrained to the sphere. In particular we will consider the confluent case where two eigenvalues of the potential coincide, which implies that the system has ▫$S^1$▫ symmetry. We will prove complete algebraic integrability of the confluent Neumann system and show that its flow can be linearized on the generalized Jacobian torus of some singular algebraic curve. The symplectic reduction of ▫$S^1$▫ action will be described and we will show that the general Rosochatius system is a symplectic quotient of the confluent Neumann system, where all the eigenvalues of the potential are double.
BiblioEntry.Descriptors: matematika /analiza /integrabilni sistemi /algebraična integrabilnost /izospektralni tok /Neumannov oscilator /posplošeni Jacobijev torus
mathematica /analysis /integrable systems /complete algebraic integrability /isospectral flow /Neumann oscillator /generalized Jacobians

BiblioEntry.Title: Nuclear spin relaxation of mesogenic fluids in spherical microcavities
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Nuclear spin relaxation of mesogenic fluids in spherical microcavities / Marija Vilfan, Martin Vuk

BiblioEntry.Title: Integrabilni sistem z zrcalno simetrijo
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Integrabilni sistem z zrcalno simetrijo / Martin Vuk
BiblioEntry.Abstract: V članku opišemo hamiltonske dinamične sisteme in obravnavamo klasično in kvantno integrabilnost le-teh. Kot primer skiciramo dokaz kvantne integrabilnosti Calogero-Moserjevega sistema. Iz dokaza je videti, kako simetrija sistema pomaga poiskati ohranitvene količine sistema.

In this paper we introduce the notion of Hamilton dynamical system and investigate its classical and quantum integrability. As an example we discuss quantum integrability of Calogero-Moser system, which shows the importance of symmetry in the search for the conserved quantities of the system.

BiblioEntry.Title: Control of scanning probe microscopes using quartz tuning forks
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Control of scanning probe microscopes using quartz tuning forks [Elektronski vir] / Borut Jurčič Zlobec, Martin Vuk, Neža Mramor Kosta

AuthorGroup.CorpAuthor: 6th EUROSIM Congress on Modelling and Simulation, Ljubljana, Slovenia, 9-13 September, 2007

BiblioSet.Title: EUROSIM 2007 : proceedings of the 6th EUROSIM Congress on Modelling and Simulation, 9-13 September 2007, Ljubljana, Slovenia. Vol. 2, Full papers
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: EUROSIM 2007 [Elektronski vir] / edited by Borut Zupančič, Rihard Karba, Sašo Blažič. Vol. 2, Full papers
BiblioSet.Subtitle: proceedings of the 6th EUROSIM Congress on Modelling and Simulation, 9-13 September 2007, Ljubljana, Slovenia

BiblioEntry.Abstract: We present a simulated controller of a scanning probe microscope using tuning forks. In scanning probe microscopy, a new technology has been developed in the last years, exploiting a skew force which results from friction between the probe tip and the smooth surface of the sample. This force can be detected at a distance of several nm above the surface. It affects the parameters of oscillation of a vibrating optical fiber positioned above the surface with forcing frequency induced by quartz tuning forks. The distance from the surface sample can be determined by measuring the shift in resonance frequency and amplitude of the oscillation. This can therefore be used for precise positioning of the probe tip above the sample surface, and for reconstruction of the surface form. The simulation is based on an efficient and robust theoretically-based algorithm. The algorithm is devised to control the tip within a specified distance above the sample, at which a precise reconstruction of the form of the sample surface can be made. It was made for the purpose of developing a digital scanning probe controller which could substitute analogue controllers that are currently in use in scanning probe microscopy. This would enable improved precision, faster response and would reduce the cost of production of the controller.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: We describe the algebraic geometric approach to nonlinear integrable systems. We presemt a method for solving integrable systems which is based on the representation of a dynamical system as a Lax equation and extensively use the theory of Riemann surfaces and their Jordan tori.

BiblioEntry.Title: On integrable systems with singular spectral curves : doctoral thesis
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: On integrable systems with singular spectral curves : doctoral thesis / Martin Vuk ; Pavle Saksida, adviser
BiblioEntry.Subtitle: doctoral thesis

Notes.Dissertation: Univ. v Ljubljani, Fak. za matematiko in fiziko, Odd. za matematiko

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Obravnavamo integrabilne hamiltonske sisteme, ki jih lahko opišemo na faznem prostoru perturbacij ranga 2 neke fiksne matrike ▫$A$▫. Znano je, da je moč take sisteme zapisati kot izospektralni tok matričnih polinomov in da je mogoče v nekaterih primerih tok linearizirati na Jacobijevem torusu spektralnevkrivulje izospektralnega toka. Obravnavamo konfluenten primer, ko dve lastni vrednosti matrike ▫$A$▫ sovpadata. V tem primeru ima sistem rotacijsko simetrijo, spektalna krivulja je singularna, tok pa je mogoče linearizirati na posplošenem Jacobijevem torusu singularne spektralne krivulje. Največjo pozornost posvetimo Neumannovemu sistemu, ki opisuje harmonični oscilator poljubne dimenzije, omejen na sfero. Dokažemo algebraično integrabilnost konfluentnega Neumannovega sistema in pokaženo, da je mogoče tok linearizirati na posplošenem Jacobijevem torusu singularne spektralne krivulje. Opišemo simplektično redukcijo simetrije ▫$S^1$▫ in pokažemo, da le-ta ustreza redukciji posplošenega Jacobijevega torusa singularne krivulje na Jacobijev torus normalizirane krivulje. Poleg tega pokažemo, da je Rosochatiusov sistem enak simplektičnemu kvocientu kofluentnega Neumannovega sistema, kjer so vse lastne vrednosti potenciala dvojne. Ta opis predstavlja novo mehanično interpretacijo Rosochatiusovega sistema.

We study integrable Hamiltonian systems, which can be modeled on the phase space of rank 2 perturbations of a fixed matrix ▫$A$▫. It is well known that such systems can be written as isospectral flows of matrix polynomials and that under certain conditions the flow can be linearized on the Jacobian of the spectral curve. We consider systems with rotational symmetry that appears as a consequence of the confluency of two or more eigenvalues of the matrix A. As a result, the spectral curve is singular and the flow has to be integrated on the generalized Jacobian of the singular spectral curve. The main example that we consider is the Neumann system, which describes the harmonic oscillator (of arbitrary dimension) constrained to the sphere. We prove complete algebraic integrability of the confluent Neumann system and show that its flow can be linearized on the generalized Jacobian torus of the singular spectral curve. The symplectic reduction of ▫$S^1$▫ action is described and we show that the symplectic reduction corresponds to the reduction from generalized Jacobian of singular spectral curve to the Jacobian of normalized spectral curve. We also demonstrate that the general Rosochatius system is a symplectic quotient of the confluent Neumann system, where all the eigenvalues of the potential are double. This gives a new mechanical interpretation of the Rosochatius system.
BiblioEntry.Descriptors: integrabilni sistemi /algebraična integrabilnost /izospektralni tokovi /Neumannov oscilator /posplošeni Jacobijev torus
integrable systems /complete algebraic integrability /isospectral flows /Neumann oscillator /generalized Jacobians

BiblioEntry.Title: O integrabilnosti nelinearnih dinamičnih sistemov : magistrsko delo
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: O integrabilnosti nelinearnih dinamičnih sistemov : magistrsko delo / Martin Vuk
BiblioEntry.Subtitle: magistrsko delo

Notes.Dissertation: Univ. Ljubljana, FMF Matematika, Raziskovalna smer

BiblioEntry.Abstract: V magistrskem delu predstavimo nekaj splošnih metod, s katerimi lahko obravnavamo integrabilnost dinamičnega sistema. Ogledali si, kako lahko za obravnavo integrabilnosti uporabimo orodja iz teorije Liejevih grup in Liejevih algeber, glavno pozornost pa posvetimo uporabi algebraične geometrije pri iskanju eksplicitnih rešitev integrabilnega sistema. Opišemo metodo reševanja integrabilnih sistemov, ki sloni na predstavitvi dinamičnega sistema z Laxovo enačbo in izdatno uporablja teorijo Riemannovih ploskev in theta funkcij. Na koncu uporabimo opisano teorijo na dveh klasičnih integrabilnih sistemih in sicer na sistemu togega telesa, podprtega v težišču, in na sistemu simetrične vrtavke.

We describe some methods of the study the integrability of non-dynamical systems. We desribe, how Lie group and Lie algebra theory can be used in the study of integrable systems. Our main interest is focused on the algebraic geometric approach to nonlinear integrable systems. We present a method for solving integrable systems which is based on the representation of a dynamical system as a Lax equation and extensively use that theory of Riemann surfaces and their Jacobian tori. Two classical examples of nonlinear integrable systems, the motion of a rigid body with fixed point in the center of mass, and the symmetric spinning top, illustrate the methods presented in this work.

integrable systems /Lax equation /Poisson manifolds /coadjoint orbits /symplectic quotient /Jacobian variety /algebraic curves /Riemann surfaces
